page.title: 18Religion,Scremerston.
page.content: On 5th November {1359 Bishop {Hatfield of Durham,}granted permission to{Robert de Tughale }to have divine service performed at his oratories at Scremerston. The{Church of St. Peter }was built in{1842/43 }at a cost of {Â£1000.}It was built in the {Early English Style, with a nave and chancel, a tower at the west end with a low octagonal spire containing one bell. It was previously under the control of the{Vicar of Ancroft,}later a vicarage was built and there was a {Vicar of Scremerston }who also had charge of the{Parish of Ancroft. { }Today the{Vicar of Spittal}is also {Vicar of Scremerston. { }The{Brown Memorial Chapel}was built in{1886}at a cost of{Â£300}for the {Primitive Methodists}and it will seat {200. }
